-sUVWGr-S2bvK3EwVuNzIA.text: Caffe Nero is already one of the better coffee chains, in my opinion, and this branch on the Royal Mile is very nice indeed. It's comfortable, and has adequate seating, even though it's a busy location. Service is prompt and friendly, and prices aren't bad either.  I popped in for a break on a busy day exploring the Royal Mile, and had a tasty hot chocolate. My friend had coffee, and enjoyed it as well. There's a nice relaxed feel about the place, and we stayed for quite a while just chatting. Recommended.

N4Uss8eduIsuX7JSKlhg8g.text: Right on the Royal Mile, it's a convenient place to pick up something quick as you tour and shop this popular area.The price of a sandwich is under 5 pounds and they will warm it up so you can have a hot bite to eat even on the go. Grab a hot beverage and you are all set for a quick lunch or a pick-me-up.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffè Nero - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pick up a sandwich and they will warm it up for you at the counter.
Photo of Caffè Nero - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Right on the Royal Mile!

b-2kZV1bh5izwN598piOdw.text: I have been to plenty of wonderful Caffe Neros and this is by far the worst. The coffee was subpar and the service was horrendous. The baristas were condescending and rude to me as well as other customers. I would not come to this location ever again. I'll go down the street to Starbucks from now on.

ujs48aGPYqA_2vuv17Kykg.text: Good thing we were met with such a warm welcome... NOT! lady at the front was rude, we're not from around here and had a few questions, didn't want to answer and expected us to know everything. Do not work in customer service if ur not customer friendly.

AMOTyhwszb-A0FCi2qbuNw.text: Dirty spoons knives forks. Young trainee barista didn't know better. His more senior associate cleaned them for me specially which was kind. It did however leave me uneasy about the cleanliness. The bathroom toilet is dirty and overused by the public despite a code on the door. The smell of bathroom deodorizer wafts into the seating area. Something has to be done about it.

hrTsnRhAXvmrT2UTVnRfCQ.text: We ran into caffe nero for coffees one afternoon. We ordered right away and were given our coffees within minutes. Great location on the royal mile.

Z1oV2Svx4nDhBD6_yRkRKg.text: Nice atmosphere with friendly service and delicious coffees and pastries (and free Wi-Fi, which is always nice)

photos.caption: Photo of Caffè Nero - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Caffè Nero - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mocha for the win...

q0UZ6jmSM5WRvHSI0wQYNA.text: This is a teeny Nero, but has full food and drink options. Thank you to the super friendly staff for giving me directions and being so cheerful on a busy Sunday. Free wifi too!

CWcCJ75opwPZ2Cgx1EKV7A.text: My wife and I really enjoyed our coffees at Cafe Nero.  This one in particular is on the Royal Mile and has a fantastic view.  We would get our coffees, which tasted great, and we would sit near a window to view all the people on the street.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.  They had a variety of coffee options and pastries as well.  An additional benefit if you are a tourist, many of the local tours will meet near here.  When we go back to Edinburgh, we will come back to Cafe Nero.

photos.caption: Photo of Caffè Nero - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Caffè Nero - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Our favorite spot to sit and have coffee in the morning.
Photo of Caffè Nero - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

P9SzMeT3_-OiZ9r7YB9h4A.text: I've come across this chain at various locations across the UK when travelling for work. The coffee is really good and consistent across the chain - far above other chains! I recommend you try the caramel waffles.

YEtGf6OZcz6yi6idERZzWQ.text: This is a nice wee addition to the Royal Mile, means I don't have to always go to Starbucks to get some free wifi.  The coffee is of a better quality than you would get in the rival establishment down the road, cakes tend to be better too. Service was really good, he was friendly and happy to help me out to sort the wifi. The main issue with this branch is it is TINY. I kid you not less than 10 tables?! So keep that in mind if you are planning on staying a while!

bUEbmYit1FedE81stjbTzA.text: I really enjoy Caffe Nero when visiting the UK and this location is no exception. Great coffee and a very central location. The baked goods are a little on the sweet side and don't quite emanate freshness but are still quite acceptable.
